info.title: AlisQI
info.description: Integrate your QMS with your ERP, MES, PLM, instruments, sensors or website using AlisQI's connectivity tools.

get.description: Get (quality) results from analysis sets or master data from selection lists.

parameters.name: setId
parameters.description: Enter the unique ID of the analysis set you're interested in (historically known as maskid in URLs).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of records you want to receive, up to a cap of 10,000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Choose a starting position for the results, useful for paging through data (defaults to 0).

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Determine the order of your data by a field and direction, like date:desc for the most recent first.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Use a JSON-formatted string to narrow down the data you're requesting, based on specific conditions.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma separated list with the specific data points you want to be returned.

parameters.name: includeAttachments
parameters.description: Mark true if you want to include any file attachments with your data, otherwise leave as false.

parameters.name: includeId
parameters.description: Set to true if you want to get the system's unique record numbers for your data, making it easier to manage or reference.

parameters.name: includeLastModificationDate
parameters.description: Turn on to get the last change date for each piece of data, which is great for tracking the most recent updates.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Accept

X-RateLimit-Limit.description: The maximum number of requests that the consumer is permitted to make per minute.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests remaining in the current rate limit window.

X-RateLimit-Retry-After.description: The time in seconds that the consumer should wait before making another request.

X-RateLimit-Limit.description: The maximum number of requests that the consumer is permitted to make per minute.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests remaining in the current rate limit window.

X-RateLimit-Retry-After.description: The time in seconds that the consumer should wait before making another request.

X-RateLimit-Retry-After.description: The time in seconds that the consumer should wait before making another request.

get.summary: Get all analysis sets or selection lists
get.description: Get a list of (all)  analysis sets or selection lists.

parameters.name: groups
parameters.description: Enter group IDs or names to find specific groups, use 'Selection lists' to get all.

parameters.name: names
parameters.description: Input the names of analysis sets or selection lists you want to retrieve.

post.summary: Create or update results or master data
post.description: Create or update quality results in analysis sets or master data in selection lists.

parameters.name: setId
parameters.description: Enter the unique ID of the analysis set you're interested in (historically known as maskid in URLs).

parameters.name: results
parameters.description: JSON object as a string.

parameters.name: keyField
parameters.description: Find and modify existing results based on this field's value.

parameters.name: editOnly
parameters.description: Use (only) in conjunction with keyField.

parameters.name: addListOptions
parameters.description: Flag to add new options to lists.

post.description: Create (a) new specification version(s) for an analysis sets.

parameters.name: setId
parameters.description: Enter the unique ID of the analysis set you're interested in (historically known as maskid in URLs).

parameters.name: specs
parameters.description: JSON object as a string.

parameters.name: indexValue
parameters.description: The index field value.

parameters.name: startDateTime
parameters.description: Formatted as yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss or unix stimestamp.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: The reason for changing the spec.
